Identification.LongTitle: “SeaRose FPSO” Repair or Alteration Remission Order, 2012

Provision.Text: His Excellency the Governor General in Council, on the recommendation of the Minister of Finance, pursuant to section 115a of the Customs Tariffb, makes the annexed “SeaRose FPSO” Repair or Alteration Remission Order, 2012.

Section.Text: Remission is granted to Husky Oil Operations Ltd., Calgary, Alberta, of the customs duties paid or payable under the Customs Tariff in respect of the “SeaRose FPSO” that was returned to Canada after having been exported in 2012 for repair or alteration.
The remission is granted on the following conditions:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the importer files, as requested, all evidence that is required by the Canada Border Services Agency to determine eligibility for remission; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a claim for remission is made by the importer to the Minister of Public Safety and Emergency Preparedness within two years after the day on which this Order comes into force.

Section.Text: This Order comes into force on the day on which it is registered.
